etymology.description: 海(sea) + 洋(ocean; vast expanse of water) = the oceans/seas.
etymology.interpretation: Combines two water-related morphemes to emphasize vast, open saltwater bodies. Commonly used collectively for Earth’s oceans and in attributive uses meaning marine/oceanic.

examples.chinese: 我们研究海洋气候变化(我們研究海洋氣候變化)。
examples.english: We study changes in the ocean’s climate.

examples.chinese: 海洋生态系统非常重要(海洋生態系統非常重要)。
许多国家依靠海洋贸易(許多國家依靠海洋貿易)。
examples.english: Many countries rely on ocean trade.
